name: NPR
text: Retail workers on furlough are collecting 42% more on average from unemployment than the grocery workers who are busy stocking shelves â€”  raising questions about fair pay and making it hard for some to return to work. https://t.co/0znxLvzmQC

name: NPR
text: After threatening to pull the convention from Charlotte if restrictions are not eased, President Trump now has Republican governors in other states lining up as alternative hosts. https://t.co/LZCPc0aBMt

name: NPR
text: 2020 looked bright for pianist Nduduzo Makhathini. But when the pandemic hit, he was summoned home for his other role: a traditional South African healer. For @nprmusic, he and his wife Omagugu Makhathini perform "healing sonics" for Alone Together Duets. https://t.co/NQhE7vzsaO

name: NPR
text:
Federal records show OSHA worked for six years to create new rules to prepare for an airborne infectious disease pandemic. The Obama White House formally added it to a list of regulations to be implemented in 2017.

Then President Trump took office. https://t.co/Pv8ffpv1k2

name: NPR
text: School leaders are warning of a financial meltdown that could devastate many school districts â€” and set back an entire generation of students.  https://t.co/F6c6EucvPf

name: NPR
text:
Geologist Keri Belcher applied for unemployment, and after seven weeks of waiting, still hadn't received a single check. She's applied for jobs, with no luck. 

"I guess I'm just a little lost," Belcher says. https://t.co/dnuVxGacmw

name: NPR
text:
All parts of the Nashville music scene were disrupted due to the pandemic, including the work of the producers and songwriters'. 

But for them, it was never "Oh, I guess we'll just have to wait." It was always, "Let's see what we can do." https://t.co/i0lCEneCDH

name: NPR
text: Comedians came together for 2 hours of stand-up to give Muslims around the world some comic relief as they do the unprecedented â€” celebrate Eid al-Fitr in isolation at home, with fewer loved ones than usual.   https://t.co/BVWXrl4FXT

name: NPR
text: An emergency physician discusses what scientists have learned in the last 10 weeks about the coronavirus â€” and what researchers still do not know. ðŸ‘‡https://t.co/GqljIafKfx

name: NPR
text:
Nancy McKinley mixes screwball humor with social criticism in a collection of interlocking stories about two women who work at a mall in Northeastern Pennsylvania.
https://t.co/KvowLlhKNP

name: NPR
text:
The need to get out of the house is real â€” but so are the risks you're taking. 

Experts have rated the risk levels of 14 summer activities, from camping to a night out. The takeaway? The risk level depends on four things: "time, space, people, place." https://t.co/surXlKp5PN

name: NPR
text: Retail workers on furlough are collecting 42% more on average from unemployment than the grocery workers who are busy stocking shelves â€”  raising questions about fair pay. https://t.co/1xKvqDOe10

name: NPR
text:
The number of new coronavirus cases has been going up in Alabama â€” even as the state's governor relaxes restrictions.

One local official says part of the problem is people who "have decided that the pandemic is over."
https://t.co/89GUu0hjEW

name: NPR
text:
Christian Cooper, the black man in Central Park who had the police called on him, says it was "pretty crappy without a doubt." 

But, wonders if the response was "really proportionate."
https://t.co/HGPEMEr30R

name: NPR
text: "People on the spectrum ... sort of feel like an alien being dropped in from outer space, and you can't quite connect properly. Being on stage ... felt like a connection I hadn't been able to establish in any other environment." https://t.co/u9wQwa2icG

name: NPR
text: With the border wall expected to plow through the center of the proud city of Laredo, a remarkably diverse coalition of wall-haters have assembled to fight it. https://t.co/v0r19VTOas

name: NPR
text: Mikel Jollett had a dramatic childhood, including escaping a cult. In his newest memoir, "Hollywood Park," he tackles the relationships that formed him â€” and wrote an album of the same name that echoes key parts of his book. Listen here on World Cafe ðŸŽ§ https://t.co/GEYHDsjhf4

name: NPR
text:
With the sheer number of deaths, obituary writers have been overwhelmed. "We do the best we can telling a variety of stories â€” about people from every ethnicity, every profession, every age level," says one Chicago Sun-Times obit writer.
https://t.co/NGIDutgC7p

name: NPR
text:
We're tracking coronavirus restrictions in every state â€” and the steps officials are taking to reopen their communities.

West: https://t.co/OgHldAuK1z
Midwest: https://t.co/N7CWj6ILsA
South: https://t.co/ktSDd6lCtB
Northeast: https://t.co/gA4xTRNcNC

https://t.co/jIyRY75bVg

name: NPR
text: Testing is a key part of reopening, but an investigation into Texas reveals more than just one of the lowest testing rates â€” it found that four out of six of the largest cities in Texas had testing sites disproportionately located in whiter neighborhoods. https://t.co/y35okYHqoN

name: NPR
text: The U.S. and China race for a vaccine is starting to feel like a "Cold War environment," experts say â€” and the battle to be the first could get even more challenging as countries compete for manufacturing rights. https://t.co/eMfc0ncexF

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
"We must accept the lingering shame and guilt,
the anger and mistrust inequality have instilled,
apologize for the damage commit to sow a future with humility.

While we await such a day,
Let us say your name:
Ahmaud Arbery,
Ahmaud Arbery,
Ahmaud Arbery." https://t.co/7a7FmIXZFE

name: NPR
text: Casinos in Nevada will be allowed to reopen next Thursday, Gov. Steve Sisolak says. The state begins Phase 2 of its reopening this Friday. https://t.co/tqXzxG7MOC

name: NPR
text: Casinos in Nevada will be allowed to reopen next Thursday, Gov. Steve Sisolak says. The state begins Phase 2 of its reopening this Friday. https://t.co/tqXzxG7MOC

name: NPR
text:
Trump threatened to shut down social media after Twitter added a fact-check warning to his tweets about mail-in ballots. 

He's long accused social media of censoring conservative views, but it's unclear what he could do to crack down on social platforms. https://t.co/tDqJPaR25Z

name: NPR
text: Thousands of people marched in the streets of Minneapolis on Tuesday, calling for criminal charges to be filed agaiâ€¦ https://t.co/t86iJNgwLW

name: NPR
text:
Coronavirus testing sites are disproportionately located in whiter neighborhoods in 4 out of 6 of the largest cities in Texas, an NPR investigation found. 

That means cases may be going uncounted. https://t.co/8emTRIsKra https://t.co/ApuJ4PNXZm

name: NPR
text:
In Soacha, Colombia, families fly red flags from their homes to signal for immediate food assistance. 

For some, these flags are a sign of charity and community. For critics, it signifies government inefficiency. https://t.co/HmkWwmSGSi

name: NPR
text:
38% of kids from America's lowest-income homes and 35% of kids in special education are doing little or no remote learning, a new survey finds.

By contrast, 83% of kids from families making over $100,000 a year are doing it every day. https://t.co/rzGNa05uM7

name: NPR
text: RT @nprworld: NEW: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says he has reported to Congress that â€œNo reasonable person can assert that Hong Kong maintains a high degree of autonomy" from China â€” a move that could lead the U.S. to withdraw preferential trade status to Hong Kong.NEW: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says he has reported to Congress that â€œNo reasonable person can assert that Honâ€¦ https://t.co/Zg1WwlAqFW

name: NPR
text:
Hungary's government will revoke a much-criticized law that allowed Prime Minister Viktor Orban to rule by decree. 

Officials say the law helped avoid "thousands of deaths," but critics warn its revocation "is nothing but an optical illusion." https://t.co/o5q724SboY

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
NASA and SpaceX appear to have brushed aside concerns about weather spawned by Tropical Storm Bertha as they prepare to launch two astronauts to the International Space Station later today.
https://t.co/qvtEEkrQOO

name: NPR
text: @NPR Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley will be making the trip aboard SpaceX's Dragon crew capsule. It's the first launch of NASA astronauts from American soil since the retirement of the space shuttle program in 2011. https://t.co/3ZLM989gQa
